= Configuration and Build =

!RipTunes does have a long list of pre-requisites, a bit how all open source project does.  If there are no details on how to build some of the dependencies, it's just the basic:
{{{
  python configure.py build
  python configure.py install
}}}

The dependencies are:
  # MinGW - http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=2435&package_id=240780
  # Python 2.6.1 - http://www.python.org/download/releases/2.6.1/
  # Qt OpenSource 4.4.3 - http://www.qtsoftware.com/downloads/opensource/appdev
  # SIP 4.7.9 - http://www.riverbankcomputing.co.uk/software/sip/download
  {{{
  # For Windows, working from C:\tools\sip-4.7.9:
  C:\tools\sip-4.7.9>python configure.py -p win32-g++
  C:\tools\sip-4.7.9>"C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe"
  C:\tools\sip-4.7.9>"C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe" install
  }}}
  # !PyQt 4.4.4 - http://www.riverbankcomputing.co.uk/software/pyqt/download
  {{{
  # For windows, the make stage takes a while,
  C:\tools\PyQt-win-gpl-4.4.4>C:\Qt\4.4.3\bin\qtvars.bat
  C:\tools\PyQt-win-gpl-4.4.4>C:\Python26\python.exe configure.py
  C:\tools\PyQt-win-gpl-4.4.4>"C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe"
  C:\tools\PyQt-win-gpl-4.4.4>"C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe" install
  }}}
  # Mutagen 1.15 - http://code.google.com/p/quodlibet/downloads/list
  # Add `C:\Qt\4.4.3\bin` in your `PATH` if it's not there.

= Running !RipTunes =
Double click `RipTunes.pyw`
